availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edward T. Clarkson (Covington trader and pork packer)

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, trader and pork packer. Kentucky native. Father of Edward Clarkson, James Clarkson, and George Clarkson. Justice of the Peace in Kenton County in 1847. Trader and pork packer in Covington in 1860.

ab.bibl: Taliaferro P. Shaffner, ed., The Kentucky State Register, for the Year 1847 (Louisville, KY: Morton and Griswold, 1847), p. 113. Williams’ Cincinnati Directory, City Guide and Business Mirror, for 1860. Together with Directories of the Cities of Covington and Newport, KY., and a List of the Post Offices in the U.S. and Territories, arranged in States and Counties (Cincinnati, OH: C. S. Williams, 1860), p. 334. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 3, p. 143. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, p. 17. Find A Grave, “Maj Edward Trabue Clarkson (November 24, 1807-November 29, 1872),” memorial #17466848, http://findagrave.com/memorial/17466848 (accessed February 16, 2018).
